sentences.en: He felt a dull throbbing pain in his head.
sentences.cn: 他感到脑袋隐隐地抽痛.

sentences.en: He had walked several kilometres over pavements, and his varicose ulcer was throbbing.
sentences.cn: 他在人行道上走了好几公里, 静脉曲张的地方又开始刺痒.

sentences.en: Her head was hammering and throbbing and the bright, sunlight stabbed into her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她的脑袋还在轰响和震颤,而耀眼的阳光又刺痛了她的眼睛.

sentences.en: Her head was throbbing and she ached all over.
sentences.cn: 她的脑袋嗡嗡作响并且浑身疼痛。

sentences.en: Her heart was throbbing after the race.
sentences.cn: 赛跑之后,她的心在剧烈跳动.

sentences.en: His ankle was throbbing, and he gave it an examination.
sentences.cn: 一只脚腕子胀得血管直跳, 他检查了一下.

sentences.en: His heart was throbbing with excitement.
His mind was throbbing with expectation.
sentences.cn: 他的心因期待而柁柁地跳着.

sentences.en: I shall not be at peace,' moaned Catherine, recalled to a sense of physical weakness by the violent, unequal throbbing of her heart, which beat visibly and audibly under this excess of agitation.
sentences.cn: “我不会得到安息的，”凯瑟琳哀哭着，感到她身体的衰弱，因为在这场过度的激动下，她的心猛烈地、不规则地跳动着，甚至跳得能觉察出来。

sentences.en: Machinery slackened; throbbing feebly like a fainting pulse; stopped.
sentences.cn: 机器慢下来了; 震动得象微弱的脉搏那样无力; 最后停止了.

sentences.en: My heart is throbbing and I'm shaking.
sentences.cn: 我的心在猛烈跳动,身子在不住颤抖.
我的心在剧烈地跳动着.

sentences.en: Pan-Arabism -- of which the post-World War II independent state of Syria claimed to constitute the "throbbing-heart" -- became a substitute for Syria's very weak national identity.
sentences.cn: 泛阿拉伯主义这个概念，系由二战后独立的叙利亚提出，主张组成一颗“悸动的心脏”，令其成为叙利亚国虚弱的民族认同的替代品。

sentences.en: She endeavoured to conceal a throbbing melancholy heart with the utmost sprightlness in her countenance.
sentences.cn: 为了掩饰她那颗惆怅郁闷的心,她在神态间故意装作十分轻松活泼.

sentences.en: The music's throbbing pulse was giving me a headache.
sentences.cn: 那乐曲的强烈节拍令我头痛.

sentences.en: There is a throbbing pain in my right eye.

words.tran_cn: 悸动；抽动；颤动；跳动着作痛；充满活力

trans.tran_cn: 跳动的，悸动的，抽动的，<医> 搏动的
抽痛( throb的现在分词 )，（心脏、脉搏等）跳动
